column1: If there is an account associated with %s you will receive an email with a link to reset your password.
column2: If there is an account associated with %s you will receive an email with a link to reset your password.

column1: Please enter your email or username.
column2: Please enter your email or username.

column1: Enable username support in your store
column2: Enable username support in your store

column1: Allow the customer to edit his username in "My Account"
column2: Allow the customer to edit his username in "My Account"

column1: Do you want to display the field 'Username' in the Manage Customer Grid?
column2: Do you want to display the field 'Username' in the Manage Customer Grid?

column1: What is the maximum length of the string username that you want to accept? By default, it's 30 characters
column2: What is the maximum length of the string username that you want to accept? By default, it's 30 characters

column1: What is the minimum length of the string username that you want to accept? By default, it's 6 characters
column2: What is the minimum length of the string username that you want to accept? By default, it's 6 characters

column1: What kind of username do you want to accept? You can set the value 'Default' which accept letters, digits and the special characters '_-'
column2: What kind of username do you want to accept? You can set the value 'Default' which accept letters, digits and the special characters '_-'

column1: Provide here a PCRE regex. e.g. /^[\w-]*$/. More info at PHP Manual
column2: Provide here a PCRE regex. e.g. /^[\w-]*$/. More info at PHP Manual

column1: Message to show to the user in case of error
column2: Message to show to the user in case of error

column1: Do you want to make the username case sensitive? If not case sensitive, the username will be saved in lowercase. The idea to save in lowercase is to not irritate the user in case he provides a wrong username case.
column2: Do you want to make the username case sensitive? If not case sensitive, the username will be saved in lowercase. The idea to save in lowercase is to not irritate the user in case he provides a wrong username case.

column1: Cannot share customer accounts globally because some customer accounts with the same username exist on multiple websites and cannot be merged.
column2: Cannot share customer accounts globally because some customer accounts with the same username exist on multiple websites and cannot be merged.

column1: Customer website ID must be specified when using the website scope.
column2: Customer website ID must be specified when using the website scope.

column1: Username is invalid! Only letters, digits and \'_-\' values are accepted.
column2: Username is invalid! Only letters, digits and \'_-\' values are accepted.

column1: Sorry but you cannot set a minimum length value %s bigger than the maximum length value %s. Please, change the values.
column2: Sorry but you cannot set a minimum length value %s bigger than the maximum length value %s. Please, change the values.

column1: Please enter your email address or username below. You will receive a link to reset your password.
column2: Please enter your email address or username below. You will receive a link to reset your password.
